edge: Sharlto Copley played the role of Wikus van de Merwe, a mild-mannered, shy, bumbling, awkward bureaucrat at the MNU Department of Alien Affairs.
Wikus van de Merwe worked at the MNU Department of Alien Affairs.
Jason Cope performed the role of Christopher Johnson, a District 9 prawn who assists Wikus in fighting MNU.
Christopher Johnson is a District 9 prawn who assists Wikus in fighting MNU.
David James played the role of Colonel Koobus Venter, an aggressive, sadistic, and xenophobic PMC mercenary-soldier sent to capture Wikus.
Vanessa Haywood played the role of Tania Smit-van de Merwe, Wikus's wife.
Mandla Gaduka played the role of Fundiswa Mhlanga, Wikus's assistant and trainee during the eviction.
Eugene Wanangwa Khumbanyiwa played the role of Obesandjo, a paralyzed psychopathic Nigerian gang leader who believes that eating alien body parts will enable him to operate their weapons.
Louis Minnaar played the role of Piet Smit, managing director of MNU South Africa and Wikus's father-in-law.
Kenneth Nkosi played the role of Thomas, an MNU security guard and good friend of Wikus.
William Allen Young played the role of Dirk Michaels, the CEO of MNU.
Nathalie Boltt portrayed Sarah Livingstone, a sociologist at Kempton Park University.
Young portrays Dirk Michaels, the CEO of MNU in this context.
Boltt's character Sarah Livingstone is a sociologist at Kempton Park University as mentioned in the context.
Strike's character Katrina McKenzie belongs to the Department of Social Assistance as described in the context.
Sumner plays Les Feldman, an MIL engineer in this context.
Blake's character Francois Moraneu is a member of the CIV Engineer Team, as mentioned in the context.
Brophy's character James Hope is an officer with the SAPS Alien Crimes Unit as described in the context.
